Indra Sjafri: Yang Memilih Pemain itu Pelatih, Bukan PSSI!
02 Nov 2019, 10:21 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Pelatih timnas Indonesia U-22, Indra Sjafri dibuat geram oleh PSSI yang mengumumkan nama pemain senior yang bakal tampil di SEA Games 2019. Menurut sang pelatih, harusnya yang memilih dan mengumumkan pemain itu dia, bukan PSSI.
Kegeraman Indra Sjafri itu mengacu pada sikap PSSI, yang membocorkan dua pemain senior yang akan masuk Timnas Indonesia U-22.
PSSI melalui Direktur Media dan Digital PSSI, Gatot Widakdo, menyebut pihaknya sedang mengupayakan mendatangkan Ilija Spasojevic dan Muhammad Rizky Eka.
Dua nama tersebut akan menggantikan Manahati Lestusen dan Septian Bagaskara. Namun, yang jadi masalah adalah, Spasojevic dan Rizky Eka tak masuk daftar 40 nama yang telah disiapkan untuk skuat SEA Games 2019.
"Yang memilih pemain itu bukan PSSI. Seharusnya saya yang bilang, kok PSSI bisa tahu? Seharusnya tidak bisa begitu," kata Indra Sjafri kepada wartawan, Jumat (1/11/2019).
"Urusan PSSI hanya menanyakan ke KOI, boleh atau tidak melakukan pergantian pemain. Untuk siapa yang masuk, itu urusan tim pelatih," tegas pelatih asal Sumatra Barat itu.
Timnas Indonesia U-22 saat ini sedang menggeber persiapan untuk bertempur di SEA Games 2019. Pemain yang hadir berjumlah 26 orang, yang akan dikerucutkan menjadi 20 pemain saja sesuai kuota.

Indra Sjafri: The Player Chooses the Coach, Not PSSI!
02 Nov 2019, 10:21 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Indonesian U-22 national team coach Indra Sjafri was infuriated by PSSI who announced the name of a senior player who would appear at the 2019 SEA Games. According to the coach, it should be the one who chose and announced the player, not PSSI.
Indra Sjafri's anger refers to the attitude of PSSI, who leaked two senior players who will enter the Indonesian U-22 national team.
PSSI through the Director of Media and Digital PSSI, Gatot Widakdo, said that his party was working on bringing in Ilija Spasojevic and Muhammad Rizky Eka.
The two names will replace Manahati Lestusen and Septian Bagaskara. However, the problem is, Spasojevic and Rizky Eka are not included in the list of 40 names that have been prepared for the 2019 SEA Games squad.
"The one who chose the player was not PSSI. I should have said, how could PSSI know? It shouldn't be like that," Indra Sjafri told reporters on Friday (11/01/2019).
"PSSI affairs only ask KOI whether or not to make changes to players. For those who enter, it is the affairs of the coaching team," said the West Sumatra coach.
The Indonesia U-22 national team is currently preparing to fight at the 2019 SEA Games. There are 26 players who will be reduced to 20 players according to the quota.
